frege.rt

Class Constant

  • java.lang.Object
    • frege.rt.Constant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Value

    public abstract class Constant
extends java.lang.Object
implements Value

    Base class for nullary constructors.

    Apart from the functionality provided by the Lazy interface, nullary consructors are just constants. The compiler will enforce that there is at most one object per constructor, though as long as object identities are not examined, this is transparent.

    Every sub class must implement the Value._c() method that tells what constant (constructor) exactly this is.

    • Method Detail

      • _c

        public abstract int _c()
        Tell what constructor this is.

        Constructor numbers are assigned by the compiler starting with 0 for each type in the order the constructors are declared. Hence, the tuple (type, constructor number) is uniqe within a frege package. Because no two types declared in different packages can be equal, it is even unique in the whole universe.

        Specified by:
        _c in interface Value
        Returns:
        a small natural number indicating the constructor for this constant

      • _u

        public final boolean _u()

        Provide default implementation of Lazy._u() for subclasses

        Returns:
        false
